text: In technical analysis, what’s a “liquidity grab”?
answers: A whale selling everything
A gap in chart data
A random candle spike
A short (or long) squeeze where stop-losses get triggered

text: What’s the primary role of VWAP in intraday trading?
answers: It calculates open interest
It identifies RSI divergences
It shows the average price weighted by volume
It shows good and poor highs and lows
When the market purposely moves to trigger trader stop-losses
When an exchange stops orders for maintenance
A type of futures funding event
A rare pattern on RSI

text: What is the 80% setup rule based on?
answers: My friends 80% sure what they doing
Price rotating through value once accepting back within
Profit target reached
Candle size reaching 80%

text: What happens when funding rates are deeply negative?
answers: The market is balanced
Shorts are paying longs, meaning selling pressure is extreme
Funding has paused
Longs are paying shorts

text: What does Open Interest (OI) increasing while price drops often mean?
answers: Market is consolidating
Shorts are being closed
New short positions entering the market
No one’s trading

text: Why is the 106–107K range on BTC considered a key level in market structure?
answers: It’s the highest open interest level ever recorded
It has acted as a critical resistance/support zone for nearly a year
It’s where all gaps get filled
It represents a Fibonacci 100% retracement

text: What is a “pivot zone” in technical analysis?
answers: A random candle that reverses
A price area that often acts as both support and resistance
A single data point on the RSI
A point where open interest resets

text: If a daily close happens above 103,500 (BTC) level after multiple rejections, what does it generally suggest?
answers: The trend is weakening
The level remains insignificant
A potential shift in market bias to bullish
That trading volume is low

text: What is typically indicated when price returns into the weekly Value Area after a breakout?
answers: The breakout is strengthening
The move might be losing momentum
The market is entering price discovery
A liquidity grab just occurred

text: In Volume Profile, what does the Point of Control (POC) represent?
answers: The level with the highest traded volume
The level with the lowest liquidity
A moving average line
The highest candle wick of the session

text: What’s the difference between RTH and ETH gaps?
answers: There is no difference
ETH gaps occur during high volume
RTH gaps appear only in crypto markets
RTH gaps happen during regular trading hours, ETH gaps occur overnight

text: What’s a “Gap Fill and Go” setup?
answers: Price fills the gap fully, then continues in the same direction
Price never touches the gap
Price fills halfway and reverses
Gaps are ignored in this scenario
Market halts during fill
Gap never gets filled
Price fills the gap, rejects, and moves back opposite direction
Volume disappears completely

text: What’s one of the best ways to cope with market swings and portfolio drawdowns?
answers: Revenge trade to win it back fast
Reduce position size, review journal, and stay consistent
Watch every tick and overanalyze each move
Double down until it recovers
